author: neels
msg: On branch 'hold': Realized that the naming --ignore-hold sucks. It could mean
"ignore the hold semantics", or it could mean "ignore the files on hold", or it
could mean "don't commit the svn:hold property", depending on the reader's
intuition.  Out of many names that crossed my mind, the only one not ambiguous
in this way was --do-not-hold. (Unfortunately --no-hold is also ambiguous.)
I considered naming the svn_client_commit6() parameter "do_hold", but decided
not to add any more reversed logic to the stew.
Here is the same log message as r1159464 with the renames of it
New function. Adds DO_NOT_HOLD parameter over svn_client_commit5().
All contents moved to svn_client_commit6(), and instead call
Add parameter DO_NOT_HOLD, and if it's true do not hold any files.
Pass new parameter DO_NOT_HOLD as TRUE to yield previous behavior in this
Call svn_client_commit6() instead of 5, passing OPT_DO_NOT_HOLD.
